reviews.text: Before arrival, we have exchanged emails with the hotel to confirm and reconfirm our booking. Our reserved room was for Deluxe Oceanview room. reviews.text: We arrived with bleary eyes @ 1am at the hotel after a 20-hour flight from Chicago. At first glance, the lobby was quite modern looking with marble surface all around and some water fountains that created that soothing feeling as we entered. I think they just renovated the hotel recently because everything still looked new. The check-in staff was courteous, friendly, and very helpful. To our delightful surprise, they told us that our room has been upgraded to a Club Level Harbour View room. However, my husband wanted to try out their suite since we knew both of us would be suffering from jetlag for the next few days so it would help to have a separate living room so that when one of us couldn't sleep, one could watch TV in another room without bothering the other. We got our suite on the 18th floor with Sing$190 extra per night which included all the Club Floor amenities (upgraded champagne breakfast for 2, fresh flowers and fruits daily, free internet access at the lounge, late afternoon cocktail with snacks, and guaranteed late checkout until 8pm). The suite was spacious and whistle clean with marble surface all around and modern contemporary design, a living room with step-out balcony and a decent size restroom with double sinks as well as study desk with leather desk amenities + high-speed internet access hookup, the bedroom has an armoire with TV, DVD player, video player, and one touch control from the night stand and big window for the water view, it also has big bathroom (all marble) with separate bathtub / shower / commode / double vanity area. The next day, we went to check their Champagne breakfast at the executive lounge and didn't like the selections (it mostly offers western types of breakfast) so we went down to 'The Melt Cafe' that has better choices with local taste. We asked that our breakfast be switched to 'The Melt' instead of the Champagne Breakfast (I dislike alcohol so I can't imagine drinking Champagne first thing in the morning with your breakfast!), and our request was granted without problem.
reviews.title: Oriental - 5 star but not right for me

reviews.text: The Melt buffet breakfast offers several dining stands: fresh fruit stand with a guy ready to help cut up your tropical fresh fruit selections or juice them for you, dessert stand, bakery stand, eggs/noodles stand with chinese dim-sum and sliced meat, american breakfast stand that has the usual bacon / omelet / scrambled eggs stuff, Indian cuisine stand, Malay cuisine stand that has Malay's Nasi Lemak and Chinese style porridges, and continental breakfast stand. Each stand offers roughly 10-15 choices of food so you'll definitely find one that you like. It has friendly and great customer service, fast, clean, and everything was run efficiently.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I stayed here from Oct 21 - 23 and must say that it exceeded my expectations. Staff were friendly, facilities were excellent, and as in everything with Singapore, hotel was connected to a mall ( Marina Square) which is connected to another mall and another mall. This is important more so if you are travelling with family. Seriously speaking, just pay up and you won't go wrong with this property. Unlike some photos you see on other hotel websites, what you see if what you get at the Oriental.

We stayed twice at The Oriental in early October - first for three days before our cruise, then three days after. For the first stay we were upgraded to a Junior suite (city view) which was quite spacious; next time we had a Harbour View room on the 8th floor and this was even better equipped than the first room. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. One of the highlights was the breakfast which was included in our rate but even to pay for the buffet is good value. It was the best buffet I have seen! The location of the hotel is excellent - lovely walks around the river and so convenient to a number of shopping malls. You can walk to Raffles Mall in about 10 minutes and the Marina Square is right next door. When the upgrade to the Mall is finished (they are still working on it) it will be great. I am returning to Singapore early next year and will definitely stay at The Oriental.

The hotel didn't do any arrangments for our celebration even a postcard.In the evening we went for a dinner at Morton's Grill. Here was the big disappointment. Very high prices for not so special meal and really poor service. The breakfast in the morning is ok but the food was cold. For my next visit I will consider Shangri-La.

likes.liked: — the main entrance and the fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 12 nights in January 2012 after a stay in Hong Kong. We experienced spectacular customer service from the staff this is really what sets this hotel apart from the others. The rooms were immaculate and very well decorated and maintained. Although the location isn't perfect (you need to get a MRT to get to orchard rd) the service we received definitely made up for it.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with extraordinary customer service

reviews.text: P.S Breakfast is huge !!!!!!
reviews.title: Good Location & Love the Song Birds

reviews.text: My finance was put here when he came to teach a 3-day class. The meeting rooms were well equipped and had natural light - which was a huge plus. And I cannot say enough good about the staff. Our room was not elaborate but certainly very comfortable and it had a balcony over looking the pool and the lights of the city. The bathroom was new and modern which was a plus for me. My finance's father also came to visit with us and his room was similar but overlooked the main street and shopping area. Again basic but very comfortable. The location of this hotel is a plus and the lobby atrium is full of music from the song birds that they have out during the day. The lobby bar is nice to hang it after a long day. Agree with others to get breakfast included with your room. Buffet is fantastic. The Italian restaurant in the hotel is also very good. We found the staff very accommodating and the location fantastic for easy access to tour buses and shopping areas. The pool area is a big plus an oasis in a big city. The only negative would be the fee for internet access.
reviews.title: A perfect and pampered point of entry for Southeast Asia

reviews.text: This large and bustling hotel with spectacular views of the Marina Bay is something of a "business resort". Our room was fairly small but beautifully appointed with every conceivable amenity. Stunning architecture belies the attentive and personal service from every member of the staff. Arriving just before dawn after an 18 hour flight from the US we made straight for the pool on the 5th floor rooftop from where we watched the sky turn from night to day. Hot ginger tea awaited our return to the room. The restaurant Melt is particularly impressive, although there are five eateries within the hotel. Inspite of the hotel being very busy, the hosts and staff at Melt knew us by name by day two. This is as close to perfection as possible in a hotel of this size. Looking forward to a return visit!
reviews.title: Oh Wow...What can I say? It was a perfect stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, 4 year old son and me had the privilege to attend our Asian Meeting in December 2011. After a luxurious ride on Thai Airways to Singapore we checked in to our room at the 17 Floor. We were greeted by super friendly staff who escorted us up to our room which was on the Club Level. Service and Rooms were perfect and my son really enjoyed the swimming pool and outdoor area. I had the chance to spin a few rounds every morning at their very nice fitness center which opens already at 0700 am. During my days of meetings and working I enjoyed the private breakfast in their Club Lounge. Service up there was extremely attentive and staff went the extra mile to please everyone of their guests. After 6pm there are free drinks (lots of different beers and wines are available) and great small snacks available. The Club lounge is also a great place to hold meetings since there 2 private meeting rooms available. Over the weekend we enjoyed our breakfast in the restaurant at the 4th Floor and let me tell you, this is something else. Their presentation is amazing and they have so many things to offer including a fruit juice bar. My son was so happy there and one of the reason is of course, that the staff at the Singapore Mandarin Oriental are very kid friendly. Folks, this place is a great experience and if you ever have the chance to stay there, then do it because for us it was an amazing 4 days with so many benefits. We felt so very welcome and happy there. Will be back here for sure as well.
reviews.title: Weekend in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked up at the airport by hotel car, arrived at the foyer where we had to wait for staff to find us for in-room check in. It must be very difficult to manage meeting people when they are arriving in your own hotel limo....
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Anyway they finally managed to locate us and walked us to the lift to complete all the normal check in procedures in the room. The lift doors opened to a wonderful sight of a completely out of this world drunk, half standing holding a glass of whatever - very uncomfortable ride to the fourth floor where our check in companion happily guided him out of the lift and onto to his next fuel top up at the bar.
reviews.title: A great hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is old & tired looking probably 70's or 80's design - Not hard to imagine that with all the development going on around Singapore that they are going to be left behind. Good location.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights enjoying the "club indulgence" package, the club is nice & big enough to accommodate a large number of guests - they have a furniture layout that places two tables next to each other near the windows. However, they seem to be very reluctant to seat different parties on either of the tables.......that is if there was one person sitting enjoying breakfast at the window they rejected our request to sit at the other free table and instead herded you off to a coffin type room with no windows and zero ambience.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also had two huge lounge set ups that would easily seat 4 to 6 but again if there was one happy camper sitting there already they appeared to accept he had the rightful claim to it all. This sitting regime only served in alienating many guest once they were walked past many empty tables/seats on their way to the coffin. We witness many other people struggling to understand and questioning this strange arrangement. Just a real dampener on what a club environment should be trying to provide guests.
reviews.title: Breakfast, rooms...out fo this world!
Very Good, almost Great....
reviews.text: This is definitely a very nice hotel, though not perfect. But perhaps I had been expecting too much, considering the Mandarin Oriental Brand and what I had seen on their website. We took the standard rooms, which were pretty good in all respects but nothing very special. Big, bright, comfortable, a balcony would have been nice. And our room was a corner room which was weirdly shaped. The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful, they really go out of their way to help you. The Atrium lobby is nice but there are miles of boring white corridors on each floor which could've been spruced up with a little more color/decoration.

The location is not the best, with few entertainment and late night dining options nearby, and the subway a long walk away. But it is right across the bay if you want a nice evening walk, and the bustling Boat Quay isn't too far away, and once you reach there the financial district is next door.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Location
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Overall a great place to stay if you don't mind a slightly out of the way location.

I was delighted with this hotel - renovated, modern, classy, incredibly clean and comfortable, friendly staff, gorgeous pool. The proximity to mall next door mall and the hawker stations across the street (on weekends) meant that I didn't need to eat in the hotel itself. (The in-house restaurants were too expensive for my liking). However, the luxurious hotel rooms make up for the lack of affordable eating options in the hotel. Just run next door and you'll have everything you need for food (and shopping if that is your thing). Great location too: quieter than being in the midst of Suntec etc. I loved my stay here and recommend it highly! I loved Little India - so much to see and great veggie Indian food. Also, the Zoo and Night Safari were fascinating and fun!
reviews.title: 5 star - but I lucked out

reviews.text: We stayed in Oriental Hotel for 4 nights at the end of Oct 05. Had Sea view room, on the 15th floor, it was spectacular! I had phoned hotel 2 days before departure that we will be arriving around 9 o’clock in the morning and our room was ready by then. The hotel is about 5 min walk from an underground station, the river, etc, next to a shopping mall. Great swimming pull. Prices in hotel restaurants are on the steep side compare with the restaurants in town and they have been empty for most of the time. We didn’t have breakfast as you can get a cheap one in any of the shopping malls. We would recommend this hotel with no hesitation!
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at some nice hotels in my time, but this one really takes the cake. I don't know if there is such a thing as a 6-star hotel, but if there is, this is one of them. Every moment of the 5 nights I spent here was amazing.
reviews.title: Most amazing hotel experience

reviews.text: When I walked into my room, my jaw dropped. The view was stunning.
reviews.title: Product Launch event at Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's right across the street from the Merlion park, and easy walking distance to lots of interesting neighborhoods. It was a little bit funny to have an indoor shopping center appended to the hotel, with lots of international shops, restaurants and chain stores, not to mention a bowling alley, but it was actually convenient to have this. As the center was largely patronized by locals, it was kind of interesting to walk around in there as well.
reviews.title: Truly Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope someday to stay again at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore.
reviews.title: Outstanding Accommodations & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the Mandarin Oriental for hosting a event and was very impressed with the services. Senior event Manager Roger Cheow and his team was a pleasure to deal with and everything was arranged flawlessly. The staff always had a smile on the face and can do attitude.
reviews.title: The Mandarin Oriental deserves its Number 1 Place
An "A" For Service, Pool, Food...But A "B" For Rooms, Common Areas, Location
reviews.text: In all fairness, the Mandarin Oriental is a fine hotel and does deserve its place among the world's better properties...but it is due some significant renovation to be at the highest level of world-class.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found service at most every turn to be both flexible and flawless, the food to be widely varied and well-prepared, and the updated pool area is both large and fantastically designed.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: My concern was that the room and bath were unimpressive, partly because of some slight but acceptable wear, but primarily because the space simply felt outdated and overdue to be totally reimagined, much like the recent pool transformation. Same could be said for the common areas, especially the hallways, which were just a bit dull.
reviews.title: Fabulous - loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is very subjective, but having now been there, I prefer Orchard Road for expanded options and a much more lively scene. Views at the Mandarin can be excellent, but street life is dull and the nearby shopping and dining options inferior to Orchard Road. That said, a cab can whisk you most anywhere in minutes.
reviews.title: Superb pool area; pity about the hotel

reviews.text: I'd be happy to return to Singapore and happy to find myself at the Mandarin, but after a bit of scouting this trip, I'd most likely pop into the St. Regis next time.
reviews.title: cool and trendy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have a chance to visit this island nation, don't miss this one to stay in Mandarin Oriential Hotel. I and my husband spent a great holiday in this hotel last time. The most impressive view was the hospitality of staffs there. We stayed in a comfortable room equipped with modern equipment such as air conditioner,TV,etc.
reviews.title: pure atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning, i could enjoy the view of beach through the window, breathing the pure atmosphere. Especially, food and relaxing services were really great. We really highly recommend it.
reviews.title: What a fantastic experience with fabulous service
Met rather than exceeded expectations
reviews.text: The Mandarin Oriental deserves all the praise in the world for the way we were treated by every member of staff - real class. We were celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary

with a tour of London, Singapore, Bali, Perth, Melbourne, Sydney and Hong Kong and I emailed the hotel to inform them of our early arrival. When we arrived they surprised us with an upgraded, beautiful suite with hot tea, chocolates and a bottle of lovely red wine. The next day they placed flowers in our room. I cannot praise the hotel and staff enough for their kindness and professionalism. From the moment we arrived it was obvious to us that we had picked the perfect place to experience a fantastic city break. We would highly recommend this wonderful hotel and we also loved Singapore.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel with service that sets a new standard for top hotels
A bit of a let down for a "luxury" hotel
reviews.text: Let me start by saying that this is a fantastic hotel, and we thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay here.

We booked the hotel for a work retreat partly on the basis of the reviews here and I must say that we were somewhat disappointed. There were around 10 of us and I must say the service of the hotel was just not up to stratch.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: 1. We arrived at the hotel around 6.30 pm and attempted to check in. This took 30 mins because some of our rooms were still not available. Given check out time is around midday, I find it somewhat strange that the rooms are still not available at that hour.
reviews.title: Room with breakfast

reviews.text: 2. We had upgraded one of the rooms to the executive floor because they wanted to charge SG500 for the use of the room for a couple of hours. This charge seemed rather high given we had a group of 10 persons staying at their hotel - could they not offer us a discount? Anyway, by getting an upgrade we could use the executive floor facilities, which included free use of the room for 2 hours. But when we tried to check in, we were informed that there was no reckon of our upgrade, despite the fact that we had phoned up twice in advance to confirm.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. We got to the executive floor room, which really was just ordinary. It was a nice well decorated modern hotel room, but quite small for a 5 star hotel room. In fact, this room turned out to be smaller than another colleague's room, which was on the ordinary floor. Go figure.
reviews.title: Great service - above average room

reviews.text: 4. On the whole, we did not find the staff to be very friendly. During check in, while the whole group was left waiting at the lobby, they could not even muster a smile or look apologetic about keeping us waiting.
reviews.title: The Oriental - True meaning of hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three days here before embarking on our cruise was just sheer bliss. Breakfasts were superb and staff in breakfast room were just so courteous and helpful.We loved the piano bar with a very good jazz singer but we were the only patrons.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a quiet area but within a short walk of all the wonderful riverside restaurants where we dined on fabulous seafood and Bombay duck!
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful!

reviews.text: We didn't use the swimming pool and gym but we were told by fellow cruisers that they were excellent.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Singapore : Perfect for our family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights on our way back to New Zealand for Christmas - it had been a busy year and decided to treat ourselves and I am so glad that we did!
reviews.title: Absolutely incredible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was great from the time we checked in until we checked out and our harbour view room was wonderful - would love to have been there on New Years Eve for the fireworks!
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary.
reviews.title: Pure class - this hotel exudes quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From arrival to departure we could not have been treated better. The staff have unbelievable memories and always greeted us in a friendly and happy way. Their smiles and pleasantries created a wonderful atmosphere and made our stay very special. They even surprised us on our anniversary with a glass of champagne at breakfast and a photo signed by all the staff in the Melt restaurant.
reviews.title: Great city hotel with immpecable service

reviews.text: Special mention should be made to Marcel Li the restaurant manager and the lovely waiting staff including Innah the lady with the best smile in Singapore.
reviews.title: Excellent !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The MO does not have the gimmicks of other hotels in Singapore (ships on top of the hotel!!!) but is still the premier hotel in the city.
reviews.title: Worth its rating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended by the Webbs
reviews.title: Very classy experience, wonderful hotel! Oriental Massage the best!

reviews.text: After staying at the nearby Marina bay Sands hotel,Mandarin Oriental felt like heaven,peaceful and beautiful warm asian decoration.I cannot fault Mandarin in any aspect,the pool area is beautiful and all the pool staff were so wonderful .The gym has the best equipment and never too full.I really enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Fabulous,classy,great service and great food !

reviews.text: We stayed for 7 nights ,there wasn't anything the staff was not willing to do,on our last day we requested for a late check out as our flight was leaving late that evening,we got to keep our room till 6 pm.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.text: The breakfast was huge and most days we just skipped lunch.The location was also very nice and I am glad I chose the Marina area versus the Orchard road ,where I think was a complete chaos day and night.There are a few malls connected to the Mandarin so it was so easy to get around and dine or take the MRT which was just beside the Mandarin.
reviews.title: Five star. Especially loved the food

reviews.text: I especially enjoyed the view of our room during the new year's eve fireworks,what a fantastic show! I will definitely come back.
reviews.title: Nice view, good location, but not your typical MO...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IMHO, This is one of the greatest hotels in the world. This location carries the Mandarin Oriental reputation.
reviews.title: Decor inside makes it look like a Holiday Inn
fantastic hotel
reviews.text: Staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, including allowing us early access to our room after arriving directly from a 12-hour flight from Europe. The room was stylish and very quiet, reasonably spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom (marble, separate shower and bath) was stocked with quality accessories. The hotel is adjacent to a large shopping mall which itself adjoins the large Suntec mall (great dining and shopping) via walkways: note that Singapore mall shops don't open until 11 AM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first three nights of our two week holiday and were pleasantly suprised by the Oriental. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff we encountered. We decided not to book inclusive of breakfast and when we asked for a recommendation at reception of where to go, they actually escorted us to the mall next door. We booked the standard room which overlooked the pool and it was comfortable and roomy by European standards. Overall we enjoyed our stay at The Oriental and will definately stay there again the next time we go to Singapore.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a few days stay at the Oriental. We had tried to book at The Raffles Plaza or the Stamford but given occupancy rates, could only get the Oriental. Compared to the other two mentioned hotels, it is hands down far superior. The Raffles Plaza and the Stamford lobbies were very corwded and had a number of conference attendees. The Oriental was much calmer.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Club floor Harbor view room which was very nice and the last night in a City Suite Club floor. For the extra $65 or so, the City Suite is a great value! The room is about 780 sq. ft. and the livign room space is ideal. The Club itself has a great cocktail hour.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Location, service, Spa, Club facilities all superb

likes.liked: — Fabulous view (Harbour View room) Walk in shower

reviews.text: We found that the best place to book the hotel was through their web site or calling them on the phone. The rates were far cheaper than places like Asiarooms or Asia Travel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels i have stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More used to the elegance of the Oriental in Bangkok I was at first a little taken back by the almost space age interior design of the hotel. There is a huge inner space with a 6 glass lift tower at its center . Restaurants, Bars and rooms are arranged around it, looking over the space.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!
